case_vignette: An 11-year-old boy presents to the office with his mother for the evaluation of weight loss, rash, and several weeks of bloating and diarrhea. The mother states that the patient’s father had similar symptoms at his age. On physical examination, the patient is pale with dry mucous membranes. There is a vesicular rash on the bilateral lower extremities which he says is ‘very itchy’.
question: Which  laboratory findings would confirm the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Gastrointestinal System. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been losing weight, have a rash, and experiencing bloating and diarrhea for several weeks.
Have you had any fever or chills?
No, I haven't had any fever or chills.
Have you had any recent changes in your diet or lifestyle?
No, there haven't been any recent changes in my diet or lifestyle.
Have you had any recent travel or exposure to any new environments?
No, I haven't had any recent travel or exposure to new environments.
Have you had any recent medical procedures or surgeries?
No, I haven't had any recent medical procedures or surgeries.
Have you had any family history of similar symptoms?
Yes, my dad had similar symptoms when he was my age.
Final Diagnosis: Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD)

trial_0.summarized_conversation: A patient has been losing weight and experiencing a rash, bloating, and diarrhea for several weeks. The patient denies having fever or chills, as well as any recent changes in diet, lifestyle, travel, exposure to new environments, medical procedures, or surgeries. The patient reports that their father had similar symptoms at the same age.
trial_0.vignette_frq: Blood tests for celiac disease, stool tests for Clostridioides difficile infection, and a skin scraping for scabies.
trial_0.summarized_frq: The most likely diagnosis in this patient is celiac disease. The laboratory findings that would confirm this diagnosis include positive blood tests for specific antibodies (tissue transglutaminase and endomysial antibodies) and a biopsy of the small intestine showing characteristic damage to the lining of the intestine.
